cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi (150 km) southwest of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest today, turning north on Tuesday and northeast on Wednesday while approaching the west coast of Florida, including Tampa Bay
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to the Anclote River, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Grand Cayman; western Cuba (Isla de Juventud, Pinar del Rio, Artemisa); Lower Florida Keys west of Seven Mile Bridge; Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Florida Keys northward to the Big Bend, with highest risk from Fort Myers through Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) probability 90%; strong tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds (≥64 kt) up to 38% possible by Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 5–8 ft possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–10 inches of rain with local maxima near 15 inches expected mid-to-late week, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; a few tornadoes possible Tuesday–Wednesday across central Florida peninsula.
